entry.content:
Guilt should be met with one of two responses. Not how to continue the perpetual resent, but instead the choice between: how this 'mistake' has been of use to me and how this 'mistake' has been of use to others.

If it was useful to you, the lesson will in due course become clear, remembered, and at best this mistake is never repeated again.

If it was useful to others they may not know it at first, but however it may be that you are either hated, reviled or silently judged so be their lesson and your reward. Try reasonably to correct a wrong understanding, apologize sincerely or say nothing if needed. Be skillful, but don't resent.

entry.content:
Funny. Funny how life's best
lies in the cloaked mystery of the moment.
Where matters so small are too large
to comprehend, fully.

Where, even though you think you know,
the more you ask, the less is answered.

The more the momental acceptance becomes a part of you,
the less you kick and scream at the dynamic -- a knowing is there.
Sometimes you must speak -- explain if you will.
And so you do your best to paint a causal back story,
but who can really do that with an honest heart?

Are we even able to understand the origin of
one days worth of thought, or do we pretend to?

Be grateful for this magnificence,
This turning wheel, sometimes yielding,
but without a moments notice
can rotate all by itself,
without any conception of 'you'.
